sentences.en: Brilliant students are ten a penny at that college.
sentences.cn: 出色的学生在那所大学里有的是.

sentences.en: Eleanor is always a penny - pinch ever since she has been young.
sentences.cn: 埃莉诺从年轻时候起就一直是个非常吝啬的人.

sentences.en: Gary clutched a penny in his fist.
sentences.cn: 加里将一枚便士攥在手中。

sentences.en: I gave him some old clothes which he made a penny of.
sentences.cn: 我给了他一些旧衣服,让他拿去换钱.

sentences.en: I paid a pretty penny for that ring.
sentences.cn: 我花了一大笔钱买了那个戒指

sentences.en: I wrote my name after Penny's.
sentences.cn: 我把自己的名字写在彭尼的下面。

sentences.en: I'm just an ordinary businessman, trying to earn an honest penny.
sentences.cn: 我只是个普通生意人, 想老老实实赚点钱谋生.

sentences.en: Leggy blondes are two a penny in Hollywood.
sentences.cn: 在好莱坞，长腿金发美女遍地都是。

sentences.en: Penny's only son was the apple of her eye.
sentences.cn: 彭妮的独子是她的心肝宝贝。

sentences.en: That house must have cost a pretty penny.
sentences.cn: 那座房子肯定花了许多钱.

sentences.en: The directors of this company feel he's worth every penny.
sentences.cn: 这家公司的主管们觉得他值得栽培。

sentences.en: The operation cost £100,000 and it was worth every penny.
sentences.cn: 那次手术花了10万英镑，但是花得非常值。

sentences.en: The unrighteous penny corrupts the righteous pound.
sentences.cn: 不正当得来的便士使正当得来的英镑也受到玷污.

sentences.en: They've got to watch every penny to make ends meet.
sentences.cn: 他们得精打细算才能维持下去.

sentences.en: Unhappily for Berkowitz, he never got a penny.
sentences.cn: 可惜伯科威茨从来没得到过一分钱。

sentences.en: Unleaded gasoline rose more than a penny a gallon.
sentences.cn: 无铅汽油每加仑涨了1分多。

sentences.en: Unleaded petrol rose more than a penny a gallon.
sentences.cn: 无铅汽油每加仑涨了一个多便士。

phrases.tran_cn: 反复出现的讨厌的人；一再出现的不需要的人

phrases.phrase: a bad penny always turns up
phrases.tran_cn: (谚)讨厌的人（或物）总是会出现（或回来）
［用于英语口语］你呆呆地在想什么啦！
(主英)太多（或太容易得到）而不值钱

phrases.phrase: in for a penny, in for a pound
phrases.tran_cn: 一旦开始就做到底；一不做，二不休
不想看见时一再出现，要想忘记但忘不掉

phrases.phrase: look after the pennies and the pounds will look af
phrases.tran_cn: (谚)积少成多；注意存小钱很快就可以积累一大笔钱
不名一文，一分钱也没有
上公共厕所（旧时英国公厕的自动门须投一便士硬币后方行开启）
(非正式，主英)最后明白了，终于明白了
[英国口语]多得很；不值钱，多而贱的；平凡的

trans.tran_cn: 便士，（美国、加拿大的）一分钱，少量的钱
trans.tran_en: a British unit of money or coin used until 1971. There were 12 pennies in one  shilling
